concept.title: Processing expectations
concept.shortdesc: Use this section to explain processing expectations for the element. In general, processing expectations help enforce consistency in how conforming DITA processors work with an element. Implementers need to pay special attention to any element that has this section.

conbody.p: Consider the following example from the shortdesc topic:
conbody.lq: When a shortdesc element occurs in a DITA map, it overrides the short description provided in the topic for the purpose of generating map-based link previews. It does not replace the shortdesc in the rendered topic itself. This means that generated map-based links to this topic will use the short description from the map for any link previews provided with the link, while the rendered topic continues to use the short description inside the topic.
